intro: Periploca preussii, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, fragrant white flowers that open at night. The plant has a woody stem with smooth, grayish bark and produces small, orange-red berries. Its leaves are opposite, oval-shaped, and have a slightly hairy texture. Periploca preussii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
